cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest toward the Cayman Islands, cross western Cuba Monday night, then move north into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida and the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba (near Pinar del Río/Isla de la Juventud)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Little Cayman, Cayman Brac, and Cuban provinces of La Habana, Mayabeque, Matanzas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Grand Cayman and Cuban provinces of Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Río, Artemisa
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cayman Islands, western Cuba, Florida peninsula, and eventually portions of the Southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind probability at Wilmington is very low (≤4% in the next 5 days).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected within the next 5 days.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain possible late in the week if Ian’s remnants track inland toward the Carolinas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and increased rip-current risk along North Carolina beaches late week.
